decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat them into play. The creatures in this deck have powerful abilities that can disrupt opponents and generate card advantage, while also providing threats that must be dealt with immediately. The deck also includes several utility spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to help control the game and protect its combo pieces. The key strategy is to quickly reanimate a game-winning threat and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help maintain card advantage and card selection, while cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide additional ways to push damage through and secure victory. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan with plenty of fetch lands and fast mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of the Skies, while also utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Reprieve to protect your own creatures. The deck aims to establish board presence with powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Solitude, while also gaining advantage through cards like Price of Freedom. The inclusion of cards like Mana Tithe and Cleansing Wildfire provide additional disruption and resource denial to further control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Broodscale and Bloodchief creatures to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm opponents. By ramping up mana with Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga, players can bring out key creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista to dominate the battlefield. Supporting cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command help boost the creatures' capabilities, while Ancient Stirrings and Malevolent Rumble provide additional consistency and control. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and unleash devastating combos to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Guide of Souls, along with versatile spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, this deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provides additional value and card advantage. Along with disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Goblin Bombardment, this deck aims to control the board and secure a swift victory through aggressive plays and powerful synergy.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around assembling key pieces that enable powerful combos, utilizing cards like Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Emrakul, the Promised End to generate overwhelming advantage. By including support cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Vexing Bauble, the deck aims to ramp up its offensive capabilities while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Urza's Saga and Malevolent Rumble. With a mix of Eldrazi Temple and versatile lands like Grove of the Burnwillows, the deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its potent synergies.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that can disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. It includes powerful cards like Phrage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly end the game. It also utilizes cards like Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and tempo advantage. The land base is built to support the aggressive strategy while ensuring mana consistency. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This UR Aggro deck aims to play a fast-paced game, with low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear putting pressure on the opponent early on. Utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Mutagenic Growth allows for quick removal of threats and additional damage. The deck also includes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter to provide additional aggression and disruption. The mana base is designed to facilitate quick casting of spells, with fetch lands like Bloodstained Mire and Scalding Tarn aiding in color fixing.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures with powerful abilities that can quickly put pressure on the opponent. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan and Scion of Draco, along with disruption spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to protect your threats. The Leyline cards help to support the multicolored mana base, ensuring you can cast your spells consistently. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control elements, while cards like Winternight Stories and Consign to Memory offer versatile options for dealing with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless offense.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures with high power and toughness, combined with efficient removal and disruption spells. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with threats and maintain board control through cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact allows for additional protection and synergy with the deck's multicolor creatures. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Arid Mesa and Wooded Foothills to ensure consistent mana fixing and access to all colors. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and card advantage, while Arena of Glory offers a potential finisher.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays while leveraging the affinity mechanic to reduce costs and flood the board with artifacts. By combining efficient removal spells with powerful artifacts like Urza's Saga, Mox Opal, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, the deck can maintain a steady stream of threats and disruption. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage and selection, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. The deck's mana base and artifact synergies enable explosive turns and consistent, proactive gameplay.

The deck focuses on ramping quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to power out Primeval Titan and other big threats. It utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Simic Growth Chamber to generate additional mana and enable powerful combo plays, such as Scapeshift to flood the board with lands or Malevolent Rumble for a big finish. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and efficient ramping capabilities.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls for added value. The deck also includes disruption in the form of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan, including mana-fixing lands like Arid Mesa, Flooded Strand, and Marsh Flats. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells and removal. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat creatures like Griselbrand into play, while also using interactive spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to control the board. The deck aims to create explosive and unexpected plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through its instant reanimation combo.

This deck revolves around using artifacts and legendary creatures to generate mana and card advantage, ultimately aiming to assemble a game-winning combo. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to fuel its engine, while also including key pieces like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kethis, the Hidden Hand to recur important spells. The deck can also disrupt opponents with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Agatha's Soul Cauldron. Overall, the strategy is to set up a powerful board state and quickly combo off to secure the win.

The deck focuses on quickly generating a large amount of mana using rituals and mana-generating spells to cast powerful combo pieces like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Opera Love Song. It also includes cards like Wish and Artist's Talent to access specific cards from the sideboard or graveyard when needed. The inclusion of cards like Valakut Awakening and Past in Flames allows for card advantage and recursion, while Wrenn's Resolve helps protect key combo pieces. The mana base includes fetch lands for consistency and dual lands for color fixing.
